review.review_title: 1.0 out of 5 stars BUYER BEWARE OF DELL, AMAZON AND THIRD PARTY SELLERS ON AMAZON!
review.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2025
review.review_text: BUYER BEWARE OF DELL, AMAZON AND THIRD PARTY SELLERS ON AMAZON.  And extended warranty company Asurion. Amazon's  practice of listing and selling products like Dell computers for third party sellers seems like a scam, since the third party seller can sell old products on Amazon where the warranty is already expired or almost so.  And I saw nothing on AMAZON's site when I bought the DELL computer that things like an expired or limited time warranty could be an issue when buying ON AMAZON from a third party seller. Bought this Dell computer on Amazon, July 16, 2024, and Jan.3, 2025 the screen separated from the cover.  Contacted Dell, and they advised the WARRANTY was EXPIRED!  That's less than 6 months.  Dell said the AMAZON third party seller resold the computer on AMAZON months after it bought the computer, and the warranty began to run earlier when the third party seller bought the computer. Not when I purchased the computer on Amazon! Spent hours on the phone with Dell, and they know about this issue with third party sellers.  Even after providing them with the Amazon invoice and receipt of when I took possession of the computer, they would not help me and apply and run the warranty to the date I bought the computer from Amazon. Amazon's rep basically said sorry, but that's my problem for buying from a third party seller. Say what?  I bought the computer on AMAZON and paid AMAZON.  Now I'm out of luck? To make matters worse, I bought an extended warranty on Amazon from Asurion on the same day I bought the Dell computer on Amazon.  When I tried to make a claim, Asurion auto responded that the Dell computer still has the manufactures warranty and to contact Dell, seemingly as a result of only having purchased the computer from Amazon in July.  And not taking into account that the warranty started to run when the third party seller bought the computer months earlier. Shame on Dell, Amazon, and Asurion.

review.review_title: 3.0 out of 5 stars WATCH OUT EVERYONE!!!
review.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2025
review.review_text: WATCH OUT EVERYONE!!! Amazon's practice of listing and selling products like Dell computers for third party sellers seems like a scam, since the third party seller can sell old products on Amazon where the warranty is already expired or almost so. And I saw nothing on AMAZON's site when I bought the DELL computer that things like an expired or limited time warranty could be an issue when buying ON AMAZON from a third party seller. Bought this Dell computer on Amazon, February 24, 2025, delivered just a couple days ago and today on March 4, 2025 I checked the WARRANTY which only had less than 6 months LEFT. Dell said the AMAZON third party seller resold the computer on AMAZON months after it bought the computer, and the warranty began to run earlier when the third party seller bought the computer. Not when I purchased the computer on Amazon! This should not be HAPPENING. I contacted the Company and they said nothing was wrong! It came saying the last time it had been updated was August 18th and took the entire first day to get up to date. In regards to the Computer, it runs super fast. It has a battery that dies really quickly which is why I was checking the warranty. The Power in this computer dies so fast and the fans are always running. It the touch screen is nice and it seems to have a good quality. The Sound is pretty good after it is updated. It seems to have more durability than most computers but time will tell.

review.review_title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Cheap but effective Laptop - Recommended
review.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2024
review.review_text: I bought this for my wife to use in doing her job which included a lot of RAM loading for use by two or three types of management software. Love the keyboard which is nice and tight and includes a dedicated number pad to the right side. The core i3 processor is decent and doesn't get overloaded until you really push it which is expected at this price pt. Sometimes it may approach its memory limit but gives decent service - for just 8GB of RAM it works well and the sound quality isn't amazing but adequate. I consider it great value for money. I recommend it but probably with 16GB RAM and at least 500GB of SSD Storage. While in Miami to the end of March this year, we visited 3 retailers of tech products and were amazed at the oversell of sub-standard electronics. When we found this after spending 1/2 day searching at major retailers, we grabbed it! Delivery took under two days and we were impressed with the performance of the laptop and we were able to avoid the over-sell and condescending attitude of poorly trained tech experts who seemed to know much less than me about their own products.

title: Dell Inspiron 3511 Laptop, 15.6" Full HD Touchscreen, Intel Core i5-1135G7 (Beats Intel i7-1065G7), 32GB DDR4 RAM, 1TB PCIe SSD, SD Card Reader, HDMI, Wi-Fi, Windows 11 Home, Black

review.review_title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good Deal!
review.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2025
review.review_text: Extremely happy with my purchase of the Dell 15in laptop. Ordered on a Monday and received it on the following Sunday. I ordered 32gig RAM and 1TB SSD. The product description claimed “in stock” but I assume the seller had to build it to my specs so it took a few days. The laptop arrived in an original Dell box and the machine inside was NEW! I was half expecting to find a refurbished laptop. In addition, a Dell 3511 was advertised but I received a 3520. A Dell warranty screen popped up during the setup and I was able to register with Dell. The machine itself… The Dell 15 3520 is light but sturdily built. It has a good feel. I’ve had other laptops that were built with soft flexible plastic. That’s not the case with this one; it feels solid. Keyboard action is good to the touch. The display is clear and bright. I would say it is generally fast. I don’t use it for anything that taxes the processer too heavily, but I do considerable work in graphics (Photoshop and CAD.) The only lag or latency I found is in Windows 11 processing not the machine itself. The battery life seems adequate, but I haven’t had it long enough to be exact. Under light to moderate usage, I think you can expect to get about 3 to 4 hours. Battery life, of course, always depends on how hard you push your machine. Be aware that this model of Dell laptop does not have a “num lock” indicator, not on the key nor on the screen. You just have to guess if “num lock” is on or off. Dell… what were you thinking?!! I solved this by finding a third-party widget on the web. (keyboard-leds.com) I now have a visual indicator in the system tray. If you’re a mouse user be aware that there is no keyboard method to easily toggle the touchscreen or touchpad on and off. You’ll have to use “device manager” to control the touchscreen and “settings” for the touchpad. Windows 11 does, however, have a nice feature in “settings” which automatically turns off the touchpad when a mouse is detected. The setup process… Set up was easy except for Microsoft’s poorly designed OneDrive feature. Be aware that if you are a Microsoft 365 subscriber, like me, Microsoft forces you to use OneDrive with Windows 11. I first tried to setup my new laptop as a “new PC” without OneDrive and that cost me untold hours of frustration. If you already have a PC using OneDrive, Microsoft ignores the fact you are setting up a different machine and will automatically start loading your new machine with your other PC’s contents. Even if you turn off OneDrive, it will turn itself back on without notification. The point here is that Microsoft will corrupt both machines and there is no fix or workaround until you remove your other PC from your OneDrive account. By then it’s too late, you must then reconfigure and reorganize both machines. While setting up this new laptop I watched Microsoft delete the desktop and other files from my old laptop. BEWARE OF ONEDRIVE! If you don’t want a mess, remove your old laptop or PC from your OneDrive account before starting setup on a new one. OneDrive could be a wonderful tool if Microsoft knew how to implement it. And don’t think you can call Microsoft to get help. They do not offer support on what they sell. If you can’t find help on the web you are out of luck. You will spend hours on the internet searching and finding possible solutions that, in the end, don’t apply to your situation and Microsoft’s web-based support is an endless loop of worthless patronization that basically says, “We’ve already got your money, you are now on your own.” Overall… Good machine, Good Price, Good Seller!

review.review_title: 1.0 out of 5 stars Dead within 7 weeks. Amazon vendor not helpful. Six months later, still not repaired by Dell.
review.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2024
review.review_text: Make sure you know from who and what you are purchasing. I purchased this laptop on Amazon thru Top Electronic store on May 3, 2024. The laptop worked fine for 7 weeks. Then one day, it wouldn't power on.  No screen, no lights, no activity.  Since it was already out of the 30 day return window, I contacted Dell directly for repair and mailed it to them under warranty repair. After receiving it, Dell told me that they would not repair it since a different SSD drive had been installed. At the time, I was under the assumption that I had purchased it directly through Dell on Amazon.  So I called Amazon. They put me in touch with Top Electronic store, the seller.  In communicating with them about the problem, they admitted that they put different SSD in the computer.  I told them I wanted a full refund because Dell would not do the repair on the laptop until I paid them $170 to put the stock SSD back into the computer after which Dell would diagnosed and repair the computer.  Top Electronic store refused and stopped communicating with me. The interesting thing in dealing directly with Dell, was that I learned that the one year warranty had started ticking in December 2023, not in May 2024 when I purchased it.  This tells me that the laptop was not a new laptop as advertised and likely a used or refurbished laptop.  Completely fraudulent in my opinion. After this, I spent a couple weeks trying to work with Amazon directly for a refund.  Ultimately, Amazon didn't refund it since it was out of the 30 day window.  In the meantime, Dell ships the laptop back unrepaired. So I decide to contact Dell again since technically it is still under warranty.  Now it's November 2024 and a local vendor for Dell is working on it. I will likely need to pay $170, but it is still not fixed. Truly one of the worst customer service experiences I have ever had.  In my communication with all of these groups and I have be civil and patient.  It has gotten me no where.  In my opinion this seller is selling used electronics at full price as new. I have now read other similar reviews with similar issues.  Buyer beware!!!

review.review_title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Not 100% Dell led to problem
review.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2024
review.review_text: Worked great for exactly 2 months. Suddenly, the system did not even recognize that the display is a touch screen. Rolling back Win 11 update, having device manager human interface search for hardware changes, doing Dell-recommended hard reset did nothing. Dell support arranged shipping to them. Dell was good about handling this promptly. Dell replaced the FACTORY 256GB SSD and removed the NOT-FACTORY Kingston 1TB SSD (yes, there are two SSD slots). It shipped the 1TB back with the unit in a separate bag. I replied to Dell support email that I received it back and had questions. Dell rep called me and patiently answered my questions. Though his accent was strongly far-eastern, I could understand most of what he said and he kindly repeated when asked. In short, 3rd party retailers will supe up a Dell product (in this case) to upgrade its specifications. I've used Kingston drives many times with no issues, so this is not a criticism of Kingston per se.  But for whatever reason it was either faulty or incompatible. This purchase was a good deal even if it turns out to be 256 GB rather than 1TB. The problem is it wasted a ton of my time to resolve. See images for Dell return letter and Dell rep reply to my questions after we spoke on the phone. My only annoyance with Dell is that when they reinstalled Windows 11 home on the new SSD, they installed the S version. Windows claims the S stands for more "secure." Perhaps, but you can ONLY install 3rd party apps downloaded from the Microsoft store. So, I could not install Zoom! That's unacceptable. I googled how to remove the S "feature" permanently. That worked, and I could then install the Zoom app.

review.review_title: 1.0 out of 5 stars issue with few keys of keyboard not working, and broken hinge
review.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2024
review.review_text: About 6 months after purchase, 4 keys on keyboard not working. 9 months after purchase, the right hinge suddenly break. I contact Dell support, and since it's still under warranty, they fix the issue. It takes about 10 days. Then, when i received my laptop and turn it on, it gave me blue screen. I contacted Dell again, and they asked me to send it back again, said that motherboard need to be replaced. I was perplex how Dell technician manage to break the motherboard while fixing the hinge. Then, Dell inform me that they found out that my laptop is missing rubber (feet), and since it's not cover by warranty, it will cost me $50+ to replace it. Again, i was amazed how can they charge me $50+ just to replace rubber feet. You can find it in amazon for less than $10. I said i don't need them to be fixed as it's not affect any functionality of this laptop. Couple days later, they send me message "Because of an issue that requires your attention, our repair technician is unable to begin your system repair. This issue might be related to your software or system password, or it may be something else." I called Dell and asked for my password to login to my account. I refuse to give it, and tell Dell to do hard reset to factory default. It's been almost a month (rather than 5 - 10 business days, Dell promise to fix my laptop). I also found that apparently there's a class action lawsuit against Dell hinge issue (you can google Dell hinge class action lawsuit) going on. Apparently, Dell (may) aware of this defect hinge, but they continue to use it on their laptop. My old Dell was about 6 years before the (right) hinge broken. Then, i purchase this one. The hinge broke less than a year, make me suspicious and google the issue, and found out about this class action lawsuit. It's been very disappointed with this product. Nothing good i can give, other than 1 star (zero if i can).

review.review_title: 1.0 out of 5 stars DO NOT BUY FROM THIS SELLER !!!
review.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2024
review.review_text: I can only begin this review with serious misgivings about this particular Dell Inspirion laptop.  When one purchases a product from a "Dell Vendor", one presumes it is a 100% Dell product.  Apparently this was not the case with this laptop.  Exactly 3 days after the Amazon/Vendor's return policy ran out, this laptop stopped working.  The error message was "Corrupt Hard Drive".  I can understand electronic devices will sometimes have issues.  I can also understand manufacturers and vendors need to have a limit on how long they will allow items to be returned.  So we called Dell Warranty Service, and they were very helpful.  They sent a box, pre-paid shipping label and we thought that would be the end of it.  Wait a reasonable time for the laptop to be repaired under warranty, and we could go on with our lives.  NOT SO.  According to the Dell Warranty Center, this particular laptop has a 3rd Party Hard Drive.  Not a hard-drive provided by Dell or installed by Dell or used by Dell.  So... our laptop was... in fact... not able to be repaired under warranty.  Dell has offered to fix the laptop and install the correct, but the repair is nearly as much as the laptop cost new from Amazon.  This is totally unacceptable!  When we bought the laptop, we presumed it was a new Dell Laptop with appropriately sourced and installed electronics that would be approved by Dell (or installed by Dell)... BUYER BEWARE of ROKC Electronics.  They have offered NO Help,  NO Sympathy,  and we are now completely out of the money we spent, and have a laptop that is absolutely Useless!!!!  I can only imagine if we were still in the window for return, they would put the same Non-Dell parts back in, and we would be facing similar issues down the road.  This is not the way to run a business.  And certainly not the way an Amazon vendor should be doing business.  Very Very Very Disappointed!

review.review_title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Happy with purchase - A few helpful things to know
review.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2024
review.review_text: I purchased a Dell 3520 Win 11 Pro from a reseller "Like New". A few things folks might find helpful. 1. Dell sells a limited set of configurations (Memory, SSD, etc), so resellers open the laptop to "upgrade" memory, SSD to offer more choice in configurations. Of course, this begs the question what components are being installed. In my case the components were reasonable: 16GB Samsung DDR4 3200 memory and WD Green 1TB SSD, but its "reasonable" to check the delivered system. 2. Microsoft defaults to keeping a "remarkable" amount of information about your activities, like every app installed, every webpage viewed, etc., so I strongly suggest logging into your Microsoft account (account.microsoft.com) and turn on every privacy control they provide. Then clear the accumulated history and log into the account in a day or so and check if they stopped accumulating data. 3. Windows PRO provides S Mode which is a restrictive version of Windows (only M$ store apps, lighter weight process controls etc). This is mostly for PCs going to less than trusted employees. Turning off S Mode is a one-way trip, i.e. it cannot be reenabled (essentially forever). The system I receive had S Mode off. This is something I would have done anyway, but it's something to consider if you need S Mode for employee users.

review.review_title: 2.0 out of 5 stars Cheap Materials, poor warranty from Dell, Amazon so far not much better. Should buy from Costco.
review.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2024
review.review_text: Cheap materials includes the plastic area of the hinges and where the hinges connect to the lid. The lid and monitor began to separate and crack due to the hinge being very tight and cracking, putting extra stress on the lid when opening. Also the keyboard is very loud and cheap in comparison to another, more expensive laptop that I own. It was difficult to find how to get support for the cracked lid case, I settled for chat through text. Several times the support people said they needed to check with "the team" and would be right back, but I would not hear from them until the next day when they said that because they have not heard from me, they will soon close the ticket. Finally their solution is for me to answer a list of questions that have nothing to do with my issue so that they can set me up with sending the laptop to be repaired. This experience with Dell support does not give me confidence that the laptop will be repaired in a timely manner. I have now reached to Amazon support to see if Amazon will stand behind the product. They gave me a return pickup and said they will give credit once they receive the laptop (I plan to purchase a different laptop with the credit). The product was picked up by UPS and delivered to Amazon two days ago, but Amazon has not acknowledged the return yet. Now, despite what the website and the Amazon employee said, I read that they can take up to 30 days to refund me. Costco stands behind what they sell, give instant credit when you are in the store, and doubles the warranty. Next time I am going back to purchasing electronics from Costco.

review.review_title: 1.0 out of 5 stars Dell follow up support, hardrives and software loads
review.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2024
review.review_text: This was the second Dell Inspiron 3520 I have tried. I also purchased an Asurion support plan as well.  From the initial software load (nothing had been added) Both units mysteriousy powered themselves on to a system login screen at 12:50 pm or 01:30am everyday. They were in a hard shutdown phase. I worked in IT for 40 years could not solve it, tempted to do a full system reload ( but did not it is a new system).  Tried a System reset and Windows load, that did not work, there were no entries in  the BIOS menus to address this either.  Contacted Asurion, they ran the same processes and test with the same results. Recommended returning to Amazon. When the second unit arrive with the same issue. I reached out to Dell support. After reviewing the system and checking the Dell system hardware page they determined the system was shipped orginally with 8 GB of memory and a 256 GB SSD drive. When ordering the system from Amazon I had chosen 16 GB and 1 TB. All that to SAY DELL WOULD NOT HELP AS THE SYSTEM HARDWARE HAD BEEN UPGRADED FROM ORIGINAL SPECIFICATIONS.  They recommended a full system format and reload if this 1 TB harddrive was to be used.  Net result the system has been returned to Amazon.  Not all systems will experience this but  I have seen 2 systems that had the same issue. That is a pattern my  friends.
